title: Can you please unfuck your match making system
body:
13 defeats in the past 16 games. Every single game is the same story, 5 enemy players all working together helping each other, running to each other's rescue every fight, while my allies stand in lane farming cs, completely ignoring the fight 2 feet away from them. 

It's not my fault if out of 10 players, I'm the only one who finishes the game with an S rank, even on a loss. That does not mean I deserve to be matched every single game with people who refuse to help their allies in a team game while I'm forced to play against 5 skilled opponents that actually help each other. 

Fix your bull shit matchmaking system to make fair teams.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Saltarin,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EO1N458E,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-04-06T13:58:09.040+0000)
>
> And {{champion:19}} on lane.
> 
> Just one thing: if it was the opposite and you had 13 wins in 16 games you would be here crying about matchmaking?

Problem is that it's worse this season due to positional matchmaking. This is something new Riot introduced. It wasn't in the previous seasons. Positional matchmaking tries to pair you against an opponent of similar skill, but your team skill/rank can vary a lot with this system, and you get people not in your rank range that you are forced to play against due to them wanting to keep queue times lower. This new system promotes people to play more games to try to balance out the coinflip games. However, matchmaking is so bad, that it may take up to 15/20 games sometimes to get the 13 wins instead of the 13 losses. In the end, you are back to where you started, or lower, and you didn't make much progress on your ranked climb because of the system. In the end, more time is wasted climbing than previous seasons.
Have you thought that maybe .... maybe it's you ?
Yes, I'm getting S rank every game with 4 inters who afk farm the lane the whole game. It must be me. How much mercury do you put in your cheerios in the morning?
you are in denial, lol S rank every game give me a break

Getting S in a loss is more difficult.
He is right, getting an S means he is better than the average. Does not make sense when he is better and still loses. 
If he ints, or AFKs, he would not get those.

Think first, nub.

If that's actually happening every game, this isn't matchmaking at that point. You just have absolute shit luck.

99.9999% of the playerbase gets an actual inter way, way less than that. You're just a statistical anomaly. That, or you can't tell the difference between inting and just doing poorly.

This guy represents like 99% of the league player base.  Yeah, most of you are awful lol not mechanically. Just with the way you act.

I hear you. Here's my day so far: 3 straight losses, despite coming into the day with a positive, can-do attitude.

Loss 1: Top lane feeds relentlessly, mid lane plays super passive and allows the enemy Zed to roam at will, thus causing our bot lane to get annihilated. Top laner continued griefing and ended up with 13 deaths. Bot laners were so underfed that they couldn't do anything. The enemy team just grouped up and took objectives at will, and ended the game.

Loss 2: Top laner died twice in the first 5 minutes and then left the game, didn't come back until 1 minute before the game ended. Enemy Diana smurf (60% win rate) mid laner popped off. The enemy team kept ambushing me to the point where I couldn't even farm my own jungle.

Loss 3: Enemy mid laner has a 68% win rate IN PLAT. https://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=ICantWaitToLose This is obviously a master or higher smurf, and please watch the replay if you don't believe me. She wrecked our whole team so completely and effortlessly it was hilarious. To make matters worse, Janna and Kalista bailed her out any time she was in a tight spot. This appeared to be a classic case of boosting.

So overall, I've lost 4 of my last 5 games despite getting an ACE on 3 of them on op.gg. The common refrain is always "people in your elo are apes, it's your fault for not solo carrying", but that's simply not true in this case, as the matchmaker is putting smurfs on the enemy team with disturbing frequency.
